As an addendum, the rejection sensitivity here is not about the fear of "losing friends". It's about the horrible feeling that comes with the experience. It's a mix of embarrassment, anxiety, self-doubt, hurt. I didn't want to feel any of these. So I just avoided doing the thing.
@Mellow_Megg I'm a lightweight so it's probably not ADHD related 🙈

It's different from an NT's version of people-pleasing. People who are rejection sensitive aren't people-pleasers. We just want to be understood, and to belong somewhere. Which is perfectly human. And perfectly valid.

We spend the majority of our lives as the odd one, different from our peers, being largely misunderstood. It's only human to want to fit in. So RSD can be super intense at times, because we worry about times when we were excluded and rejected, and we don't want it to happen again

So tired of dealing with NTs who put labels on ND experience. They just don't understand what we go through, what our living experience is like. So they try and compare it with their own, undermine our experience and judge us.
